DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether the patient has peripheral neuropathy grade 2 or greater.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the toxicity of an adverse event.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An unwanted effect caused by a drug or therapy.  Such effects can be drug related, dose related, route related, patient related, caused by an interaction with another drug, or caused by opioid initiation or dose escalation.

Concepts.definition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

ObjectClass.changeDescription: Change concept code to C41331 as C2861 is retired per EVS. dw

Property.preferredDefinition: Toxicity; the degree to which something is poisonous.

Concepts.definition: The finding of bodily harm due to the poisonous effects of something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does the patient have signifi
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have significant peripheral neuropathy defined in the NCI CTCAE v3.0 as a grade 2 or greater neurosensory or neuromotor toxicity?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have persistent peripheral neuropathy or hearing loss >= Grade 2

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is Neuropathy (sensory and motor) less than or equal to CTCAE grade 1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_TEXT_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have greater than or equal to grade 2 peripheral neuropathy

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the neuropathy (sensory and motor) less than or equal to CTCAE Version 4.0 Grade 1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have sensory or motor neuropathy greater than or equal to grade 2, according to CTCAE v5.0?

DataElement.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form
DataElement.changeDescription: Replaced VD Adverse Event Ind-2 2018371v1 with VD ID#3506068 - Yes No Indicator - dbw
